segments.text: I see the woman drying dishes, and I feel a strange sense of calm from her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She doesn’t seem bothered by anything, not even the water at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are being so sneaky, and it makes me smile.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I love how the boy is stretching so far to get those cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl looks so innocent, just waiting for her share.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman might be in her own little world, ignoring everything else.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is getting worse, but she’s still focused on that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s sad that she’s missing all the little moments happening around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, like nothing bad could ever happen there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever notice the kids or the water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene feels like a quiet moment before something big happens.
segments.speaker: PAR
